title: 1950 BRDC International Trophy
text: The 2nd BRDC International Trophy meeting – formally the International Daily Express Trophy – was held on 26 August 1950 at the <a href="Silverstone%20Circuit">Silverstone Circuit</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. The race was run to <a href="Formula%20One">Formula One</a> regulations, and was held over two heats of 15 laps each, followed by a final race of 35 laps. Italian driver <a href="Nino%20Farina">Nino Farina</a> emerged the winner, in an <a href="Alfa%20Romeo%20in%20Formula%20One">Alfa Romeo</a> <a href="Alfa%20Romeo%20158">158</a>, repeating his victory from the <a href="1950%20British%20Grand%20Prix">1950 British Grand Prix</a>, held at the same circuit in May. He beat his Argentine team-mate <a href="Juan%20Manuel%20Fangio">Juan Manuel Fangio</a>, and British driver <a href="Peter%20Whitehead%20%28racing%20driver%29">Peter Whitehead</a> in a <a href="Scuderia%20Ferrari">Ferrari</a>. Other notable entrants were the two <a href="British%20Racing%20Motors%23V%2016">BRM V16</a> cars entered for <a href="Raymond%20Sommer">Raymond Sommer</a>, <a href="Peter%20Walker%20%28driver%29">Peter Walker</a>, <a href="Raymond%20Mays">Raymond Mays</a> and <a href="Reg%20Parnell">Reg Parnell</a>. However, their legendary lack of reliability resulted in neither car completing a lap in anger.
